meanings.definition: The quality or state of being low in position or height.
meanings.sent1: The lowness of the table made it easy for the toddler to reach.
meanings.sent2: The lowness of the valley provided a sense of security.
meanings.sent3: The lowness of the chair made the cat think it was a throne.
meanings.sent4: The lowness of the ceiling made the room feel cramped.
meanings.sent5: The lowness of the mountain was daunting to the climbers.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being low in rank or importance.
meanings.sent1: The lowness of the job title did not reflect his skills.
meanings.sent2: The lowness of his salary was disappointing.
meanings.sent3: The lowness of the position made him work harder to prove himself.
meanings.sent4: The lowness of the grade made him strive for better results.
meanings.sent5: The lowness of the award left him feeling unappreciated.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being low in pitch or volume.
meanings.sent1: The lowness of the singer's voice was soothing.
meanings.sent2: The lowness of the music added to the melancholy atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The lowness of the sound made it hard to hear the announcement.
meanings.sent4: The lowness of the bass made the speakers vibrate.
meanings.sent5: The lowness of the hum in the room was calming.
